Module com.example.sudoku
Package com.example.sudoku.model

Class Sudoku

java.lang.Object
com.example.sudoku.model.Sudoku
public class Sudoku extends Object
The Sudoku class represents the model of a 6x6 Sudoku board. It provides the necessary methods to interact with the board, including retrieving, setting numbers, validating moves, and resetting the board.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Sudoku()
    Initializes the Sudoku board with predefined numbers and editable cells.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sudoku

      public Sudoku()
      Initializes the Sudoku board with predefined numbers and editable cells. The board is represented as a 6x6 grid, where 0 indicates an empty cell.

  • Method Details

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the number at the specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-5).
      column - The column index (0-5).
      Returns:
      The number at the specified position, or 0 if the cell is empty.

    • setNumber

      public void setNumber(int number, int row, int column)
      Sets a number at the specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      number - The number to set (1-6).
      row - The row index (0-5).
      column - The column index (0-5).

    • resetBoard

      public void resetBoard()
      Resets the board by clearing all editable cells to 0. Non-editable cells remain unchanged.

    • isEditable

      public boolean isEditable(int row, int column)
      Checks if a specific cell is editable.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-5).
      column - The column index (0-5).
      Returns:
      true if the cell is editable; false otherwise.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(int row, int col, int number)
      Validates whether placing a number in the specified cell is a valid move. A move is valid if the number does not already exist in the same row, column, or 2x3 quadrant.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-5).
      col - The column index (0-5).
      number - The number to place (1-6).
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid; false otherwise.
